div.a: About

li.a: Who to contact during the school building closure

div.a: About

td.a: Who to contact during the school building closure

span.div: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is responding to an outbreak of respiratory disease caused by aÂ new coronavirus that was first detected in China, but now has spread to countries across the world, including the United States. According to the CDC, the virus has been named SARS-CoV-2, and the disease it causes is called Coronavirus Disease 2019, which is abbreviated âCOVID-19.â On March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) started characterizing COVID-19 as aÂ âpandemic,â which means that aÂ disease epidemic has spread across aÂ large region of the world.

div.br: The Loveland City School District works with other government entities in our area to monitor and coordinate efforts in regards to any situation that could potentially pose aÂ threat to the health, safety or welfare of our community. We monitor the situation through constant communications with county and state health partners as well as updates from the CDC.Â Loveland Schools along with aÂ long list of others organizations have come together to mitigate the negative impact on the community from the health crisis. AÂ hotline (513) 781-6345 is staffed by volunteers from 7Â a.m. until 10 p.m., seven days aÂ week. You can also email [emailÂ protected]. Visit the Loveland Community Resources website for more information and to learn how residents in the Loveland area can receive help at this time.

It is important for the district to be part of the greater efforts to limit the spread of the virus in our community as aÂ whole, and for that reason, we are following the guidelines as they are released by state health officials and the Ohio governor. The guidance changes rapidly and we encourage you to visit this page and other resources listed here frequently to stay on top of the situation and keep yourself informed about the measures you can take to stay healthy.
